docs.snippet: Latin-American credit and collection conditions have improved since the first of this year, according to the quarterly survey released yesterday by the foreign department of the National Association of Credit Men. Credit gains are reported from...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin-American credit and collection conditions have improved since the first of this year, according to the quarterly survey released yesterday by the foreign department of the National Association of Credit Men. Credit gains are reported from twelve countries, William S. Swingle, director of the foreign department points out.

docs.snippet: The classified statement yesterday by the Department of Commerce on the origin and destination of gold imported or exported in February shows that of the $37,644,428 gold imports for the month $19,441,108 came from Japan and $8,416,773 from Canada.

docs.snippet: WHILE business marks time in the third year of an international depression, the nations of the world are rapidly involving themselves in a system of tariffs and trade controls for which there is no parallel in their experience.
